message:
Enjoy the MyGNUHealth demo at FOSDEM? Then join Dr Luis Falcon for a #firesidechat this Friday, 12 February at 17:00 UTC. Learn all about the new app, ask questions, suggest add-ons or pitch your ideas during a nice and relaxing conversation. https://community.kde.org/Fireside_chats
Image Courtesy: Vecteezy

Grab some popcorn and discover your inner Kubrick. Learn video-editing with Kdenlive with Massimo Stella. Hurry! The movie starts in 30 minutes at our FOSDEM booth. https://meet.kde.org/b/pau-i3q-gea
or
https://stands.fosdem.org/stands/kde_community/

Dr Falcon in the house! Luis Falcon MD. will be demonstrating MyGNUHealth, KDE's new Personal Health Monitoring application for desktop and mobile devices in 30 minutes. Don't miss your appointment! https://meet.kde.org/b/pau-i3q-gea
or
https://stands.fosdem.org/stands/kde_community/

Tomaz Canabrava is demonstrating Konsole's new features in 30 minutes. Be there and get updates from the most powerful terminal app in the known universe. https://meet.kde.org/b/pau-i3q-gea

message:
Learn more about Neochat, KDE's Matrix chat client created by Carl Schwan and Tobias Fella. Join Carl Schwan in 30 minutes at our FOSDEM booth for a live demo: https://meet.kde.org/b/pau-i3q-gea
You can chat with other participants at KDE’s booth through the Matrix live chat: #kde-stand:fosdem.org

Wake up your inner artist! Ramón Miranda is demonstrating Krita in 30 minutes at our FOSDEM booth: https://meet.kde.org/b/pau-i3q-gea
You can still interact with other participants at KDE’s booth through the Matrix live chat: #kde-stand:fosdem.org

Build an app that will work on the desktop and mobile live using Kirigami with Marco Martin. Don't miss our live programming session starting in 15 minutes in our FOSDEM chat room. https://stands.fosdem.org/stands/kde_community/

A FOSDEM booth without stickers is no booth at all... We have stickers! Come visit KDE's Matrix room and get yours!

https://stands.fosdem.org/stands/kde_community/

message:
Letters from Kate:

Dear Internet,

2021 has just started, but it has already been a great month for me! I have so many things to tell you about.

Take my Quick Open dialog, for example: it not only got a nice facelift, but also a new fuzzy matching algorithm.

Another thing I got is a fancy head-up display that lets you easily find menu items. If it exists, I'll find it!

Combine that with my new search-and-replace text feature and semantic highlighting and your productivity will shoot through the roof.

I could go on all evening, but they say that the good, when brief, is twice as good.

Stay safe!

XOXO

Kate

https://kate-editor.org/post/2021/2021-01-24-kate-january-2021/

comments.message: I'd love to see that in KDevelop. Is it possible to integrate it there?

message:
Kontact, KDE's set of utilities that helps you manage your email, calendars, contacts and more, has received more than a 1000 improvements just in the last two months. Developers are also working on porting Kontact to Windows.

https://www.volkerkrause.eu/2021/01/06/kde-pim-november-december-2020.html

comments.message: It works right now? Always when I try to use it, it shows errors on MySQL and Akonadi, I even don't understand why it uses MySQL...

I keep returning to Kontact from time to time but then I realise how broken it is. I've never wexperienced something like this with other PIM or mail clients. It's usually akonadi that breaks regardless of the distribution I use. It's so sad. I really *want* to like it even with its clunky GUI.
OMG, I love the idea!

It's a bit simple :(. I love if you integrate python scripting for making hooks, when adding/removing/updating a contact. And option to use it from the command line or from a python module. Various UI filters and search methods will help a lot :).

message:
New releases for KDE software in January include KIO Fuse, an add-on that lets all applications like LibreOffice access remote files safely as if they were local; lots of bugfixes; and exciting new apps MyGNUHealth, KGeoTag and Kongress adopted into KDE.

https://kde.org/announcements/releases/2021-01-apps-update/

Talking about KIO, every Kubuntu release I hope that the Dolphin MTP bug gets fixed. Is this fixed yet? That should be a priority because people plug Android phones in and expect it to work without crashing and having to dual boot into Windows to connect MTP devices.

It's been broken for years and years and years, and every Kubuntu LTS release is yet another dissapointment, crashes yet again when connecting an MTP device. Looked into it and it seems to be related to Dolphin/KIO.

https://pointieststick.com/2021/01/01/kde-roadmap-for-2021/

comments.message: Wayland session on my system (OpenSUSE Tumbleweed) is basically unusable (terrible screen tearing/flickering and countless bugs). I hope it gets better this year.
"brand new start menu" - please, not again :( The one from KDE2 or KDE 3 was great, it only missed a search bar.

I hope they get the Start Menu better.
For starters, an option for an icon that is bigger than taskbar icons would be nice, so it stands out as an actual menu and is easier to click.
Also would be nice if it's more compact, and devoid of the retarded tiles - those really are just a fad-, meaning I could could click things without having to scroll my mouse over half the screen.
and kwin tabbed windows support...please.

#KDETip: Push windows to the sides or top and bottom of the desktop by holding the [Meta] (Windows) key and then hitting an arrow key. 💡
.
.
.
🎶 And a Happy New Yeeeeeeaaar!!!🎶🎉

You can also hit two arrow keys, quickly one after another, to move a window to a quarter of the screen (new in Plasma 5.20).

The Solution of our Christmas quiz:

- Plasma desktop
- KDevelop (KDE's IDE)
- Konsole (KDE terminal emulator)
- Dolphin (KDE file manager)
- Kate (KDE text editor)
- Qt Designer - used in the development, The Qt Company is a KDE patron
- LabPlot's source code
- KDE's sticker on the monitor's foot
- Suse's Geeko - SUSE is a KDE patron
- Pen with the insignia "Google Summer of Code 2014" - KDE participates in GSoC every year+ Google is a KDE Patron
- Paul Brown - a member of the KDE promotion team - the name is visible in the window title of Firefox
- Ivan Čukić book on C++ (cukic.co/to/fp-in-cpp) - Ivan is a KDE developer

- Bonus: Karlo - the KDE kat

message:
Xmas came early: Kdenlive 20.12 is out. KDE's advanced video editor now comes with an in-built subtitler, lets you apply transitions to several track simultaneously, adds new effects (including 3D and VR), improves performance, and much more.

https://kdenlive.org/en/2020/12/kdenlive-20-12-is-out/

This week in KDE - all the things!: Okular lets you digitally sign the documents you view, all KDE software supports the AV1 image format, Kate lets you swap highlighted content with the clipboard, and many more things.

https://pointieststick.com/2020/12/18/this-week-in-kde-all-the-things/

MyGnuHealth, the personal health tracking and recording component of GNUHealth, becomes a KDE project! MyGnuHealth can track your heart rate, blood pressure and other vital signs, nutritional and lifestyle factors that have an effect on your health.

https://invent.kde.org/pim/mygnuhealth/

message:
KDevelop makes creating complex development projects easier for coders. KDevelop provides all the tools you need from a modern, feature-rich development environment and works on most platforms and supports a wide variety of programming languages. Check out all its advantages here:

https://www.kdevelop.org/

The release of version 5.6.1 brings more stability and more features to this fantastic integrated development environment. Read about this new version here:

https://www.kdevelop.org/news/kdevelop-561-released

message:
KDE's cyber-kool projects get a new release with more polish, new breathtaking features in your favorite apps.

Say hello to Itinerary, an app that helps you while on the road; check out the new features in Dolphin (file manager), Konversation (chat client) and Kontact (email, contacts and calendars); and annotate screenshots in Spectacle; among many other things.

https://kde.org/announcements/releases/2020-12-apps-update

message:
This week in KDE — Big accented/alternative character input feature: hold and press a key and a hint box with alternative similar characters pops up, letting you choose which one to use. This lets you choose characters not currently in your keyboard layout or different currency symbols.

This week's batch of improvements also includes tweaks to the Gwenview image viewer and the Dolphin file manager; corrections for Konsole, System Settings and Discover; and bugfixes for the Elisa music player, among others:

https://pointieststick.com/2020/12/04/this-week-in-kde-big-new-accented-alternative-character-input-feature/
